As for Reagan bailing the country out, you give to much credit to politicians' ability to have a lasting impact on economy. Did you read Stockman's recent indictment of Washington, including the Reagan administration that he was a part of?

Message.Title: "Momentum Stocks Breaking Down"
Message.Msg: Just now on Bubblevision, I mean CNBC Fastmoney.

They've also brainwashed everyone to expect a 5% drop, 10% max. If we hold 20% within losses we will be lucky. S&P shouldn't have crossed 1400, but they had to try to compel people into the market. Trust has been obliterated, so they cannot get retail as the greater fool (except through the highly collusive AAPL/AMZN pain trade designed to dump as much as possible into passive ETFs and tracking funds before breaking down). MOMO stocks are breaking down because EVERYONE knows they are a complete scam. They also know the market will correct in Q2 and scams like this have no chance of outperforming real investments. So, by the end of the quarter it will be crazy ugly (yes, under 180 here and on the way to 100). Those that dump first dump best. The scalpers will want to hold this for earnings and then tank it further than anyone imagines possible (think CMG's 25% drop or GMCR's 50% drop). Any long with large positions in AAPL and AMZN should be selling as much AMZN as the quant scalpers will buy to keep the options they sell from being in the money. This currency will lose 30% of its value over the next 3 months...

By the way, those 20MM AAPL shorts that piled up, or 10MM in excess of historical levels will require about $4.5B of covering just to get back to "normal" levels of short interest. At the same time, Amazon is about 3-4MM shares below historical short levels, I'm going to enjoy seeing AAPL rip through $500 on an earnings squeeze and watching those that played this pain trade get decimated... They'll be liquidating everything in sight to cover the AAPL shorts (because it was "dead money", even though a much more sound investment than Scamazon). A few days later, AMZN will fall 20-30%. Geegee and NAS will never be heard from again...
Denise Yamada on Fastmoney said market could sell off up to 10% in a hurry--almost 1500 Dow points.

Message.Title: fire wall street, congress, fed finance and oversight
Message.Msg: Just start from scratch - we'd all be better off

I'm just saying that CNBC has been prepping everyone for a 5% dip to buy because the market will for sure be higher at year and and can only go up... Which is complete hogwash. Almost all USD denominated assets (cash, stocks and bonds) will lose value in real terms. All of them. It is just that MOMO stocks where all of the BS value is in the tail in growth that isn't coming because of real world constraints will lost 70-80%+ of their value over the next 2-3 years. Amazon could very easily become insolvent (it really only grows working capital, not true discretionary FCF so any systemic shock that stopped sales growth for a few months would create severe cash flow problems... Add to that the cash held in European tax haves that may end up confiscated and the always looming possibility of oil shocks...).. Despite all the rhetoric you hear about oil independence, you never hear the "price" of oil at which we might achieve independence. It isn't going to be lower.... NAS is wrong. The cost drivers will continue to move against Amazon. When Webvan tried (and failed miserably) to do what Amazon is now trying, at least the underlying economic tradeoff was far more in its favor (cheap gas and high interest rates rather than the reverse)... I really do hope that bricks and mortar stores start pricing strategically to encourage adverse selection biases for Amazon -- they should raise prices on high purchase frequency, low value density items so that everyone (especially Prime members) orders those items from Amazon. It would be great to see how far that $79 a year would go purchasing paper towels, toilet paper, weights, office paper and food products like potato/corn chips, etc... Amazon economics will get much uglier if/as average order size drops. Folks are going to learn the hard way that Amazon's cost structure is not vastly superior as NAS would like you to believe. This will become a famous activity based costing case study someday...
we agree... SPY stop at yesterday's low and go short at closing bell FB to Long at close AMZN stop out at yesterday's low and go short at closing bell VXX to Long at close thanks

Spammerz of the pts: And tomorrow you will be in agreement az the pts 180's and you get whipsawed again. What sybs would really like to know iz what brokerage house that pts iz tied to. Those guyz are making a mint.

Topic.Title: At no point in history have markets been so high and so hated Simultaneously.

Message.Msg: True. Because the entire play the past 6 months has been a pain trade designed to allow those with access to unlimited leverage (the Fed's masters) to create an exit for themselves. Crush any sensible investment (AAPL, INTC, GLD) and cover/squeeze shorts on any scam. Keep selling vol because who needs protection when real investments are undervalued with MASSIVE short interest and scams are now trading 100% higher than they would have been... Any sale at these levels is a gift... So, now they can let the scams go... No one wanted to buy AMZN at 220 in the Fall after Q3 earnings when CapWorld had to sell a ton of AAPL to support AMZN. Now everyone is anchored to thinking that it won't break 250. FMR and CapWorld have pulled the rebalancing and distribution into strength levers about as hard as they can be. Much harder to distribute when the market is going down... An active manager has to want to accumulate at these prices and no competent active manager does...

Topic.Title: Now tech iz starting to understand-he's no longer saying "except for intc" (or some other pick on bs fundiez)

Message.Msg: True tech for now, but energy independance and safe gaurding criticle natiral resourcez will be the basis of a sustainable recovery following wall street and the banking system being reset in a wash out. People, including sybil, will be much kinder and more apprecitive of the simple thingz just az they were in the hardships of the 1930's... All that needs to remain in tact iz the constitution w/ 3 independant branchez of governement that suports life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness and we'll be just fine.... Back to the fundiez we need to go. "Despite all the rhetoric you hear about oil independence, you never hear the "price" of oil at which we might achieve independence. It isn't going to be lower.... NAS is wrong." True , but oil, amzn, and the entire pumped up markets will be heading much, much, much lower to adress the pure hate and disdain built into amercan market scamz..... The best dayz are behind us for a while, but from the pain ahead, bankerz will learn a trade, and the US will emerge strong, independant, with less medling in world affairz.

"You really think the counterparties will default on put options syb?" Yes this time counterparty derivativez will fail. Their excess through etfs will not be honored just az in 2008 for a brief moment az 2 money mkt fundz broke the buck before the fed stepped in with MASSIVE intervention , but failed to let off the gas.... Once the markets stabilized in mid 2009, bernanke should have stopped and reserved some gun powder. He didnt, now we will all pay the price, including the collapse if the sacred USD due to lack of ability or will to save it... Sybil will ride bear etfs down to s&p 1100 and get out with attempts to secure cash in multiple fdic insured accounts, and in the margin account, sybil will stay only short the underlying without derivatives until the s&p prints 450-550. Its just the way it iz..... Wake up idiots! Its coming. What you dont see az possible happening will happen.

"The reason it won't happen is because when they do that, the options game is OVER, at least for years. The FED would print to pay off the put holders." Ex, The fed wont be able to keep optionz traderz whole, they did that already in 2008 and it created more problemz .... The fed will truely be limited and will do everything it must in order to save the USD and its world reserve status.... Just imagine people in greece and cyprus thinking that they wouldnt ever have their savingz scalped? Optionz, swaps, derivativez are going to be low on the list of thingz to save, dude. Far behind savingz, the USD, bond holderz, and money market cash in pensionz pensionz... If we are lucky - it will stop at optionz contracts getting thrown in the trash. If we are not, then the fed royally fvck ed up and the USD will lose reserve status with interest rates north of 15% and unemployement at a solid 30% with no safety net UE income checks being delivered because we cant print the check or mail it through the USPS that will be closed. Thats whats at risk.... No free ridez bernanke, greenspan, keynez and any other supporter of fiat currency printing to support scam financez.
